description: Let s check 1st file kaggle input Milk Grading 1. This will create a copy of the code and environment for you to edit. Click the blue Edit Notebook or Fork Notebook button at the top of this kernel to begin editing. read_csv Distribution graphs histogram bar graph of column data For displaying purposes pick columns that have between 1 and 50 unique values Correlation matrix drop columns with NaN keep columns where there are more than 1 unique values Scatter and density plots keep only numerical columns Remove rows and columns that would lead to df being singular keep columns where there are more than 1 unique values reduce the number of columns for matrix inversion of kernel density plots specify None if want to read whole file Milk Grading 1. csv may have more rows in reality but we are only loading previewing the first 1000 rows. IntroductionGreetings from the Kaggle bot This is an automatically generated kernel with starter code demonstrating how to read in the data and begin exploring. Delete modify and add code as you please. Now you re ready to read in the data and use the plotting functions to visualize the data. Exploratory AnalysisTo begin this exploratory analysis first use matplotlib to import libraries and define functions for plotting the data. Hey I m just a kerneling bot not a Kaggle Competitions Grandmaster There is 1 csv file in the current version of the dataset The next hidden code cells define functions for plotting data. Click on the Code button in the published kernel to reveal the hidden code. Happy Kaggling plotting linear algebra accessing directory structure data processing CSV file I O e. csvLet s take a quick look at what the data looks like Distribution graphs histogram bar graph of sampled columns Correlation matrix Scatter and density plots ConclusionThis concludes your starter analysis To go forward from here click the blue Edit Notebook button at the top of the kernel. Depending on the data not all plots will be made.
